schema.name: mAdminState
schema.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
schema.label: Enable administrative state
schema.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
schema.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>
Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
schema.summary: A brief descriptive summary for the configuration
schema.name: UserSummary
EnableDebugMode
schema.summary: Whether to enable debug mode to put security error details in response headers
schema.description: When you use a validation endpoint, specifies whether to enable debug mode. In debug mode, security error details are sent in the <tt>x-apic-debug-oauth-error</tt> and <tt>x-apic-debug-oauth-error-desc</tt> response headers.

schema.name: ProviderType

value.name: native
value.description: Uses IBM API Connect as the OAuth provider.

value.name: third_party
value.description: Uses an OAuth provider other than IBM API Connect.

schema.summary: The type of the provider
schema.description: Specifies the type of the OAuth provider.

Specifies the scopes that the access token is valid to access. To specify multiple scopes, use a space between each scope. The order of scopes does not matter. Scopes ensure that the granted access token is valid to access only specific protected resources.
schema.summary: The scopes that the access token is valid to access
schema.name: ScopesAllowed
DefaultScopes
schema.summary: The default scopes to apply when the request does not contain a scope
schema.description: <p>Specifies the default scopes to apply when the request does not contain a scope. To specify multiple scopes, use a space between each scope. The order of scopes does not matter.</p><p>The default scopes must be a subset of the allowed scopes that are defined by the API security OAuth requirement configuration. When no default scope is defined and the request does not contain a scope, an invalid scope error is returned for the request.</p><p>Scopes ensure that the granted access token is valid to access only specific protected resources.</p>

schema.name: SupportedGrantTypes
schema.summary: Supported methods to grant authorization

value.summary: Uses the implicit grant type to obtain authorization
value.name: implicit
value.description: In the implicit flow, the client receives the access token directly from the resource owner.

value.summary: Uses the password credential of the resource owner to obtain authorization
value.name: password
value.description: In the resource owner password credentials flow, the client uses password credentials of the resource owner to obtain authorization.

value.summary: Uses JSON Web Token (JWT) Bearer Token to obtain authorization
value.name: jwt
value.description: In the JWT flow, the client uses a previously obtained JSON Web Token to obtain authorization.

value.summary: Uses client credentials to obtain authorization
value.name: application
value.description: In the client credentials flow, the client uses its own credentials to obtain authorization.

value.summary: Uses authorization codes to obtain authorization
value.name: access_code
value.description: In the authorization code flow, the client directs the resource owner to an intermediary authorization server. The server issues access token to the client after authenticating the client.

schema.description: Specifies the supported grant types where each grant type defines a method to grant authorization to client applications.

schema.name: SupportedClientTypes

value.name: confidential
value.description: Confidential clients are capable of maintaining the confidentiality of their credentials, or capable of secure client authentication using other means. A web application is a confidential client.

value.summary: Public client - native application or user-agent-based application
value.name: public
value.description: Public clients are incapable of maintaining the confidentiality of their credentials, and incapable of secure client authentication via any other means. Native applications and user-agent-based applications are public clients. <ul><li>A native application is installed and executed on the device used by the resource owner.</li><li>In a user-agent-based application, the client code is downloaded from a web server and executes within a user-agent (for example, a web browser) on the device used by the resource owner.</li></ul>

schema.summary: Types of client who can obtain access tokens
schema.description: Specifies the supported client types that are authorized to obtain an access token.

schema.name: APICProviderBasePath
schema.summary: Base path URL for the OAuth provider API
schema.description: When the provider type is API Connect, specifies the base path on which the OAuth provider API is served. The default base path is <tt>/</tt> .

schema.name: APICAuthorizeEndpoint
schema.summary: URL to the authorization endpoint
schema.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies the endpoint where the client application obtains authorization grant. The default authorization endpoint is <tt>/oauth2/authorize</tt> .

schema.name: APICTokenEndpoint
schema.summary: URL to the token endpoint
schema.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies the endpoint where the client application exchanges an authorization grant for an access token. The default token endpoint is <tt>/oauth2/token</tt> .

schema.name: APICEnableIntrospection
schema.summary: Whether to enable introspection of access tokens
schema.description: When the OAuth provider is API Connect, specifies whether to enable the introspection of access tokens. When enabled, authorized protected resources can introspect the access token to determine the metadata for making appropriate authorization decisions. By default, token introspection is disabled.

schema.name: APICIntrospectEndpoint
schema.summary: URL to the introspection endpoint
schema.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies the endpoint through which the token introspection operation is accomplished. The default introspection endpoint is <tt>/oauth2/introspect</tt> .

schema.name: APICEnableRevocation
schema.summary: When to enable token revocation
schema.description: When the OAuth provider is API Connect, specifies whether to enable the revocation of access tokens. When enabled, users can revoke the access token when they change their mind and decide that they do not want the client application to continue to have access to their resources. By default, token revocation is disabled.

schema.name: APICRevocationEndpoint
schema.summary: URL to the revocation endpoint
schema.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies the endpoint through which the token revocation is accomplished. The default revocation endpoint is <tt>/oauth2/revocation</tt> .

schema.name: APICTokenSecret
schema.summary: The secret of the token
schema.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies the secret of the generated token.

schema.name: APICOneTimeUseAccesstoken
schema.summary: Whether to enable the one-time use of an access token.
schema.description: When the OAuth provider is API Connect, controls whether to set access tokens to one-time use.

schema.name: APICAccessTokenTTL
schema.summary: The lifetime for the access token
schema.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies the time that an access token remains valid in seconds. The default value is 3600.

schema.name: APICAuthCodeTTL
schema.summary: The lifetime for the authorization code
schema.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies the time that an authorization code remains valid in seconds. The default value is 300.

schema.name: APICEnableRefreshToken
schema.summary: Whether to enable the use of refresh tokens
schema.description: When the OAuth provider is API Connect, controls whether to enable issuing refresh tokens. Refresh tokens are issued to the client. Refresh tokens are used to obtain a new access token when the current access token becomes invalid or expires or are used to obtain additional access tokens with identical or narrower scope. By default, this setting is disabled.

schema.name: APICOneTimeUseRefreshtoken
schema.summary: Whether to disable the one-time use of a refresh token.
schema.description: When the OAuth provider is API Connect, controls whether a refresh tokens is one-time use. <ul><li>When enabled, the refresh token is one-time use. This setting is the default value.</li><li>When disabled, the refresh token can be reused until it expires or is revoked.</li></ul>

schema.name: APICRefreshTokenLimit
schema.summary: The maximum number of refresh tokens allowed
schema.description: Specifies the number of refresh tokens allowed to be generated. The default value is 10.

schema.name: APICRefreshTokenTTL
schema.summary: The lifetime for the refresh token
schema.description: When the provider is API Connect and the refresh token is enabled, specifies the time that a refresh token remains valid in seconds. The default value is 5400.

schema.name: APICMaximumConsentTTL
schema.summary: The lifetime for the consent
schema.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies the time that a consent remains valid in seconds. The default value is 0 which disables maximum consent.

schema.name: AdvScopeValidationEnabled
schema.summary: Whether to enable advanced scope validation
schema.description: Indicates whether to enable advanced scope validation that you can use to provide additional scope checking.

schema.name: AdvancedScopeURLOverride
schema.summary: Whether to use the URL from the API Security Definition or from the OAuth Provider Settings.
schema.display: Use URL from API Security Definition
schema.description: Indicates whether to use the URL from the API Security Definition or from the OAuth Provider Settings.

schema.name: AdvancedScopeURL
schema.summary: Advanced scope URL to send updated scope for validation.
schema.description: Adds the ability to send scope information to an external endpoint where the given scope is verified. The property is required when advanced scope validation is enabled.

schema.name: AdvScopeTLSProfile
schema.summary: TLS client profile to secure the HTTPS connection to the advanced scope URL
schema.display: TLS profile to access advanced scope URL
schema.description: When the advanced scope URL uses the HTTPS protocol, specifies the TLS client profile to secure the connection.

schema.name: AdvScopeURLSecurityEnabled
schema.summary: Whether to enable security on the advanced scope endpoint
schema.description: Indicates whether to secure connections to the advanced scope endpoint.

schema.name: AdvScopeURLSecurity
schema.summary: How to secure the advanced scope endpoint

value.name: basic-auth
value.description: When you use basic authentication header, you require users to provide valid user name and password to access the endpoint.

schema.description: Specifies how to secure connections to the advanced scope endpoint.

schema.name: AdvScopeBasicAuthUserName
schema.summary: User name for authentication
schema.description: When the security type is basic authorization header, specifies the user name for authentication.

schema.name: AdvScopeBasicAuthPassword
schema.summary: Password for authentication
schema.description: When the security type is basic authorization header, specifies the password for authentication.

schema.name: AdvScopeBasicAuthHeaderName
schema.summary: Header name to use for sending encoded or non-encoded authentication string in the header
schema.description: When the security type is basic authorization header, specifies the header name to use in the <tt>curl</tt> command when you want to append encoded or non-encoded authentication string in the header. For example, <tt>x-basic-authorization-header</tt> .

schema.name: AdvancedScopeCustomHeaders
schema.summary: Custom headers to send with the advanced scope validation request
schema.description: Adds ability to send additional headers in the advanced scope validation step. Use a regular expression match to include headers from the initial request.

schema.name: AdvancedScopeCustomContexts
schema.summary: Custom context variables that can be selected with the advanced scope validation request
schema.description: Adds ability to save headers in the advanced scope validation step as context variables. Use a regular expression to include headers from the advanced scope endpoint response.

schema.name: APICEnableOIDC
schema.summary: Whether to enable OIDC for authentication
schema.description: When the OAuth provider is API Connect, specifies whether to enable OIDC to verify the identity of the user. When enabled, the client application verifies the identity of the user based on the requirement of an OIDC provider before requesting access to client resources. By default, OIDC token generation is enabled. OIDC is only available for Implicit and Authorization Code grant types.

schema.name: APICOIDCHybridResponseTypes
schema.summary: Which artifacts are supported with the OIDC Hybrid Flow

value.name: code_id_token
value.description: Supports request of ID Token as well as AZ Code from authentication endpoint.

value.name: code_access_token
value.description: Supports request of Access Token as well as AZ Code from authentication endpoint.

value.summary: AZ Code, ID Token and Access Token
value.name: code_id_token_access_token
value.description: Supports request of ID Token and Access Token as well as AZ Code from authentication endpoint.

schema.description: When the OAuth provider is API Connect, specifies which OIDC Hybrid Flow artifacts can be returned from the authorization endpoint.

schema.name: APICSupportPKCE
schema.summary: Whether application will support PKCE
schema.description: When the grant type is Authorization code, indicates whether the application should enforce PKCE if provided by the client. For more information, see RFC 7636.

schema.name: APICRequirePKCE
schema.summary: Whether application must enforce PKCE
schema.description: When the grant type is Authorization code, indicates whether the application must enforce PKCE. For more information, see RFC 7636.

schema.name: APICSupportPKCEPlain
schema.summary: Whether to support the PKCE 'plain' code challenge transform method
schema.description: When the grant type is Authorization code, indicates whether to support the PKCE <tt>plain</tt> code challenge transform method. For more information, see RFC 7636.

schema.name: APICTokenTypeToGenerate
schema.summary: The type of access token to generate

value.name: Bearer
value.description: Generates Bearer access tokens.

schema.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies the type of access token to generate.

schema.name: MetadataFrom
schema.summary: Where to obtain custom metadata

value.summary: From the response headers received from the authentication URL
value.name: authentication_url
value.description: An HTTP GET request is sent to the authentication URL and the metadata is returned in specified response headers.

value.summary: From the response headers received from an external metadata URL
value.name: external_url
value.description: An HTTP GET request is sent to an external metadata URL and the metadata is returned in specified response headers. Metadata obtained from the metadata URL overwrites any existing metadata obtained from the authentication URL.

schema.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies where to obtain custom metadata of the access tokens.

schema.name: MetadataURL
schema.summary: The URL to a remote server where to obtain the metadata
schema.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies the URL to a remote server where the custom metadata is stored.

schema.name: MetadataSSLProfile
schema.summary: TLS client profile to secure the HTTPS connection to a remote metadata provider
schema.display: TLS profile to access metadata URL
schema.description: When the external metadata URL uses the HTTPS protocol, specifies the TLS client profile to secure the connection.

schema.name: MetadataHeaderForAccessToken
schema.summary: Response header for access token
schema.description: Specifies which value, among the response header values that the authentication or metadata URL returns, to place in the access token.

schema.name: MetadataHeaderForPayload
schema.summary: Response header for payload
schema.description: Specifies which value, among the response header values that the authentication or metadata URL returns, to place in the response payload.

schema.name: ExternalRevocationURL
schema.summary: URL to an external management endpoint
schema.description: Specifies an external endpoint through which the token management is accomplished.

schema.name: ExternalRevocationSSLProfile
schema.summary: TLS client profile to secure connection to the external management service
schema.description: Specifies the client profile to use for TLS connection to the external management service.

schema.name: ExternalRevocationURLSecurity
schema.summary: How the external management endpoint is secured

value.name: basic-auth
value.description: When you use basic authentication header, you require users to provide valid user name and password to access the endpoint.

schema.description: When the native OAuth provider uses an external management service, specifies how to secure connections to the service endpoint.

schema.name: ExternalRevocationBasicAuthUserName
schema.summary: User name for authentication
schema.description: When the security type is basic authorization header, specifies the user name for authentication.

schema.name: ExternalRevocationBasicAuthPassword
schema.summary: Password for authentication
schema.description: When the security type is basic authorization header, specifies the password for authentication.

schema.name: ExternalRevocationBasicAuthHeaderName
schema.summary: Header name to use for sending encoded or non-encoded authentication string in the header
schema.description: When the native OAuth provider uses an external management service, specifies the header name to use in the <tt>curl</tt> command when you want to append encoded or non-encoded authentication string in the header. For example, <tt>x-introspect-basic-authorization-header</tt> .

schema.name: ExternalRevocationCustomHeaderFormat
schema.summary: Pattern of header names to use for sending additional information in the header
schema.description: When the native OAuth provider uses an external management service, this specifies the pattern of header names to include from the original message. For example, <tt>x-external-management-*</tt> .

schema.name: ExternalRevocationCacheType
schema.summary: How to cache external management service responses

value.summary: Uses the cache behavior that is defined by any returned Cache-Control header.
value.name: Protocol
value.description: Uses the cache behavior that is defined by the <tt>Cache-Control</tt> header on the response from the external service.

value.name: NoCache
value.description: Does not cache documents. This setting is the default value.

value.name: TimeToLive
value.description: Keeps documents in the cache for the specified time.

schema.description: When the native OAuth provider uses an external management service, controls how to cache management responses.

schema.name: ExternalRevocationCacheTimeToLive
schema.summary: The validity period for external management service responses in the cache.
schema.description: Sets the validity period in seconds for external management service responses in the cache. The default value is 900.

schema.name: ExternalRevocationFailOnError
schema.summary: Indicates whether to stop processing if connection to external management service fails.
schema.description: Whether to stop processing if external management query fails. If failed, stops the token generation or use and returns an error.

schema.name: EnableTokenManagement
schema.summary: Specify if security token details should be managed and stored.
schema.description: Enabling token management for security token details provides the ability to create one-time use tokens, prevent AZ code reuse, and support allow listing through the use of the token manager.

value.name: native
value.description: Manage and store security token details using an internal token manager.

value.name: external
value.description: Delegate token management operations to an external service.

schema.name: TokenManagerType
schema.summary: Token manager type
schema.description: Specifies the token manager type to manage and store security token details.

schema.name: APISecurityTokenManager
schema.summary: The security token manager.
schema.description: The security token manager that stores security token details. This property is read-only.

schema.name: EnableApplicationRevocation
schema.summary: Enable revocation by application.
schema.description: Enabling application revocation will allow the application to revoke the consent provided before the token expires.

schema.name: ApplicationRevocationEndpoint
schema.summary: The application revocation endpoint.
schema.description: The endpoint that will process application revocations.

schema.name: EnableOwnerRevocation
schema.summary: Enable revocation by resource owner.
schema.description: Enabling resource owner revocation will allow the resource owner to revoke the consent provided before the token expires.

schema.name: OwnerRevocationEndpoint
schema.summary: The resource owner revocation endpoint.
schema.description: The endpoint that will process resource owner revocations.

schema.name: TokenValidationReq

value.name: connected
value.description: Connected successfully to the third-party endpoint.

value.summary: Connected successfully and access token is valid
value.name: active
value.description: Connected successfully to the third-party endpoint and the access token is valid.

schema.summary: Requirement to indicate when a token is valid
schema.description: When checking responses from the third-party endpoint, specify the requirement that must be satisfied to prove that a token is valid.

schema.name: ThirdPartyAZURL
schema.summary: URL to the authorization endpoint
schema.description: When the OAuth provider type is third-party, specifies the endpoint where the client application obtains authorization grant.

schema.name: ThirdPartyTokenURL
schema.summary: URL to the token endpoint
schema.description: When the OAuth provider type is third-party, specifies the endpoint where the client application exchanges an authorization grant for an access token.

schema.name: ThirdPartyIntrospectURL
schema.summary: URL to the introspection endpoint
schema.description: When the OAuth provider type is third-party, specifies the endpoint through which the token introspection operation is accomplished.

schema.name: ThirdPartyIntrospectCacheType
schema.summary: How to cache third-party provider responses

value.summary: Uses the cache behavior that is defined by any returned Cache-Control header.
value.name: Protocol
value.description: Uses the cache behavior that is defined by the <tt>Cache-Control</tt> header on the response from the external service.

value.name: NoCache
value.description: Does not cache documents. This setting is the default value.

value.name: TimeToLive
value.description: Keeps documents in the cache for the specified time.

schema.description: When the OAuth provider type is third-party, controls whether to cache successful responses on the gateway, and for how long.

schema.name: ThirdPartyIntrospectCacheTimeToLive
schema.summary: The validity period for third party provider responses in the cache.
schema.description: Sets the validity period in seconds for third-party provider responses in the cache. The default value is 900.

schema.name: ThirdPartyAuthorizationHeaderPassThru
schema.summary: Controls whether to retain the Authorization header for a bearer token.
schema.description: When the OAuth provider type is third-party, whether to retain or remove the <tt>Authorization</tt> header for a bearer token. The default behavior is to remove this header.

schema.name: ThirdPartyIntrospectURLSecurity
schema.summary: How to secure the introspection endpoint

value.name: basic-auth
value.description: When you use basic authentication header, you require users to provide valid user name and password to access the endpoint.

schema.description: When the OAuth provider type is third-party, specifies how to secure connections to the introspection endpoint.

schema.name: ThirdPartyIntrospectBasicAuthUserName
schema.summary: User name for authentication
schema.description: When the security type is basic authorization header, specifies the user name for authentication.

schema.name: ThirdPartyIntrospectBasicAuthPassword
schema.summary: Password for authentication
schema.description: When the security type is basic authorization header, specifies the password for authentication.

schema.name: ThirdPartyBasicAuthHeaderName
schema.summary: Header name to use for sending encoded or non-encoded authentication string in the header
schema.description: When the OAuth provider type is third-party and the security type is basic authorization header, specifies the header name to use in the <tt>curl</tt> command when you want to append encoded or non-encoded authentication string in the header. For example, <tt>x-introspect-basic-authorization-header</tt> .

schema.name: ThirdPartyCustomHeaderNameFormat
schema.summary: Pattern of header name to use for sending additional information in the header
schema.description: When the OAuth provider type is third-party, specifies the pattern of header name to use in the <tt>curl</tt> command when you want to append additional information in the header. For example, <tt>x-introspect-*</tt> .

schema.name: ThirdPartyIntrospectSSLProfile
schema.summary: TLS client profile to secure connection to a remote endpoint
schema.description: Specifies the client profile to use for TLS connection.
